intro: Ototropis megaphylla, commonly known as the large-leaf ototropis, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, upright stems that bear opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy surface. Its small, white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Ototropis megaphylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
